title: How to use your leave to get the most out of the Christmas holidays
text:
Make the time to spend with your loved-ones over the Christmas holiday (Photo: iStock) YOU MIGHT ALSO LIKE {{item.title}}

It’s the most wonderful time of the year! Well, at least that’s how the jingle goes anyway.

The stores are full and frantic, the traffic seems to have either disappeared or doubled (depending on where you live) and the Christmas lights everywhere make the country look and feel more festive.

It's Christmas time!

With an incredible selection of events to check out and destinations to head to, the only thing you may be lacking is time. Luckily, this guide will help you get more time with less leave.

This year, Christmas falls on a Wednesday followed by Day of Goodwill on Thursday, 26 December. It also happens to be the school holidays, so this is a great opportunity to spend time with your family and loved-ones.

Try boosting your holiday by taking leave on Monday 23, Tuesday 24 December and Friday 27 October. With an extra 3 days of leave you’re getting a full work-week off sandwiched in between two weekends - which adds up to some solid time off to do what you want.

For the ultimate Christmas holiday leave hack, take leave from Tuesday 17 (after the public holiday on Monday 16 December) until 31 December. Those 8 days of leave will get you a whopping 18 days off for your festivities and merry-making!

description: 2020 is around the corner and with so much to do around Christmas time, you may find the only thing lacking is time. This guide will help you get more time with less leave.
